auto_minor_version_upgrade.description: Enables automatic upgrades to new minor versions for brokers, as Apache releases the versions.

configuration.description: Configuration of the broker. See below.

deployment_mode.description: The deployment mode of the broker. Supported: `SINGLE_INSTANCE` and `ACTIVE_STANDBY_MULTI_AZ`. Defaults to `SINGLE_INSTANCE`.

encryption_options.description: Configuration block containing encryption options. See below.

engine_type.description: The type of broker engine. Currently, Amazon MQ supports only `ActiveMQ`.

engine_version.description: The version of the broker engine. See the [AmazonMQ Broker Engine docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazon-mq/latest/developer-guide/broker-engine.html

host_instance_type.description: The broker's instance type. e.g. `mq.t2.micro` or `mq.m4.large`

publicly_accessible.description: Whether to enable connections from applications outside of the VPC that hosts the broker's subnets.

security_groups.description: The list of security group IDs assigned to the broker.

subnet_ids.description: The list of subnet IDs in which to launch the broker. A `SINGLE_INSTANCE` deployment requires one subnet. An `ACTIVE_STANDBY_MULTI_AZ` deployment requires two subnets.

maintenance_window_start_time.description: Maintenance window start time. See below.

logs.description: Logging configuration of the broker. See below.

user.description: The list of all ActiveMQ usernames for the specified broker. See below.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

id.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

instances.description: A list of information about allocated brokers (both active & standby).
